I.C.S.E. 2010 63.2% PROJECT DETAILS: MINI PROJECT: ADVANCE VOTING SYSTEM Description: A replica of current Electronic Voting Machine used in general elections worldwide. The concept of paper trail is introduced to recount the votes manually. In this voting system, there will be a dual counting of votes to ensure fair elections. A paper trail will be printed every time a vote is casted, which will directly go to the ballot but will also be shown to the voter. In this way if any technical tampering is done with machine, the error will be corrected by ballot box. This project can be used for small scale elections. PROJECT: SOLAR POWERED SYSTEM FOR THE CABIN APPLIANCES OF TRUCK (Sponsored by Omni Consultancy Services) Description: Solar energy being the most clean and renewable source of energy is certainly the future. As an engineer it is my ethical duty to give something back to society. This project aims at running cabin appliances of truck by driving solar energy from the panels which are placed on the top of the cabin. Thus reduces fuel consumption and in money expense. This project has a lot of future scope including smart grid technology. Real Time Transaction Update: The Vodafone Connect application used by retailers did not get a real time transaction update whereas the competition applications had real time update. 2. Incentive Transfer to Other Vodafone Sim: Since the incentive to retailer was being given on a SIM that wasnt being used by the retailer, but could also not be handed over to a family member given the business requirements, transferring the incentive to a family members SIM made the incentive lucrative again. 3. Smartphone Holder Since one reason cited to not hand smartphone over to customer by retailer was safety and security concern, smartphone holder could be used that competition used in certain areas of rural India. 4. Incentive Dashboard: To tackle improper and incoherent communication related to incentives that was otherwise in a verbal/informal format, use a dashboard on V Connect application to drive usage of application. 5. 100% Cashback through Retailer Recharges: Retailers will get incentives if they make recharges through V Connect application and customers will get 100% cashbacks through the retailer recharges. 6. Ninja Incentive Dashboard: A simple dashboard on m power for DSEs to see where they stand on their incentives as per Sherdil scheme and/or other incentive schemes 7. Vodafone Sales Academy: Provide training modules for the use of various options on m power and how they are to be implemented in the market. Keep regular tests and minimum cutoffs for the same. Description: An initial coin offering (ICO) or initial currency offering is a type of funding using cryptocurrencies. Mostly the process is done by crowdfunding but private ICOs are becoming more common. In an ICO, a quantity of cryptocurrency is sold in the form of "tokens" ("coins") to speculators or investors, in exchange for legal tender or other cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin or Ethereum. The tokens sold are promoted as future functional units of currency if or when the ICO's funding goal is met and the project launches. In some cases like Ethereum the tokens are required to use the system for its purposes.

Description: An initial coin offering (ICO) or initial currency offering is a type of funding using cryptocurrencies. Mostly the process is done by crowdfunding but private ICOs are becoming more common. In an ICO, a quantity of cryptocurrency is sold in the form of "tokens" ("coins") to speculators or investors, in exchange for legal tender or other cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin or Ethereum. The tokens sold are promoted as future functional units of currency if or when the ICO's funding goal is met and the project launches. The scope of the project was to study the usage of the three applications through market visits and secondary data. Proposed Solutions: 1. Real Time Transaction Update: The Vodafone Connect application used by retailers did not get a real time transaction update whereas the competition applications had real time update. 2. Incentive Transfer to Other Vodafone Sim: Since the incentive to retailer was being given on a SIM that wasnt being used by the retailer, but could also not be handed over to a family member given the business requirements, transferring the incentive to a family members SIM made the incentive lucrative again. 3. Smartphone Holder Since one reason cited to not hand smartphone over to customer by retailer was safety and security concern, smartphone holder could be used that competition used in certain areas of rural India. 4. Project 2# Project Name: Roaming Billing system Domain : Telecom Roaming is the ability for a customer of mobile communications to automatically make and receive telephone calls, send and receive data, or access other services while travelling outside the geographical coverage area of the home network, by means of using a network of another operator. Roaming can be either national roaming or international roaming. National roaming means that mobile subscribers make use of another network in geographical areas, where their own operator does not have coverage. This is, e.g., used by operators, who do not have complete coverage in a country. International roaming is used when mobile subscribers travel abroad and make use of the network of an operator in the foreign country. CDRs generated in one roaming partner's area are collected and rated by that roaming partner and finally they are sent to the actual service provider of the roaming customer. Actual service provider charges the end customer for all the roaming services provided based on their predefined service charges. Roles and Responsibilities: Requirement Analysis: Analysing the requirements and communicating with BA team for better understanding of the requirements.
